intro: Orthogoneuron dasyanthum, commonly known as the rough-leaved orthogoneuron, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
